content:
TITLE: Accessing Hyperdrive in Code DESCRIPTION: JavaScript example showing how to access and use the Hyperdrive binding in application code, including fallback handling for missing configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-postgres-fullstack-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` if (c.env.HYPERDRIVE) { const sql = postgres(c.env.HYPERDRIVE.connectionString); // Use SQL client } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Hyperdrive in wrangler.jsonc DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for setting up Hyperdrive bindings in wrangler.jsonc. This snippet shows how to specify the Hyperdrive binding, ID, and local connection string for development. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-postgres-ssr-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "hyperdrive": [ { "binding": "HYPERDRIVE", "id": "YOUR_HYPERDRIVE_ID", "localConnectionString": "postgresql://myuser:mypassword@localhost:5432/mydatabase" } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Database Schema Definition SQL DESCRIPTION: SQL schema format for storing book records in the PostgreSQL database. Defines the expected structure for book entries including title, author, description, cover image path, and genre. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-postgres-fullstack-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` (INDEX, 'BOOK_TITLE', 'BOOK_AUTHOR', 'BOOK_DESCRIPTION', '/images/books/BOOK_COVER_IMAGE.jpg', 'BOOK_GENRE') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Hyperdrive in JavaScript code DESCRIPTION: Example of how to access the Hyperdrive binding in your JavaScript code. This snippet demonstrates checking for the Hyperdrive environment and creating an SQL client. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-postgres-ssr-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` if (c.env.HYPERDRIVE) { const sql = postgres(c.env.HYPERDRIVE.connectionString); // Use SQL client } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Next.js Project with Cloudflare Template DESCRIPTION: Command to start a new project using the Cloudflare C3 CLI with the Next.js starter template. This creates a new project with all necessary configurations for Cloudflare deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/next-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/next-starter-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Hyperdrive Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shell command for creating a new Hyperdrive configuration with a PostgreSQL connection string using the Wrangler CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-postgres-fullstack-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npx wrangler hyperdrive create my-hyperdrive-config --connection-string="postgres://user:password@hostname:port/dbname" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Project with React Router Template using Cloudflare CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize a new project using the React Router starter template with the Cloudflare CLI (C3). This is the recommended way to start a new project outside of the repo. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/react-router-starter-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Hyperdrive in Wrangler DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up Hyperdrive database binding in wrangler.jsonc. Includes binding name, Hyperdrive ID, and local connection string for development. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-postgres-fullstack-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "hyperdrive": [ { "binding": "HYPERDRIVE", // Name used to access the binding in your code "id": "YOUR_HYPERDRIVE_ID", // ID from the create command "localConnectionString": "postgresql://myuser:mypassword@localhost:5432/mydatabase" // Local dev connection } ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Comments from D1 Database - SQL DESCRIPTION: Basic SQL query to retrieve limited comments from the database. Shows the fundamental query structure used in the template to fetch data. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/d1-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` SELECT * FROM comments LIMIT 3; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Comments Table Data - SQL DESCRIPTION: SQL insert statement to populate the comments table with initial sample data. Creates three example comments with author and content fields. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/d1-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` INSERT INTO comments (author, content) VALUES ('Kristian', 'Congrats!'), ('Serena', 'Great job!'), ('Max', 'Keep up the good work!') ; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Hyperdrive Configuration for MySQL DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Hyperdrive configuration with a connection to a MySQL database. This sets up the connection between Cloudflare Workers and the MySQL database with caching disabled for administrative purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/mysql-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler hyperdrive create hyperdrive-configuration --connection-string="mysql://:@:3306/" --caching-disabled ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing and Using an Astro Component in MDX DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import an Astro component (HeaderLink) and use it directly within MDX content. The component is rendered with an onclick handler that shows an alert when clicked. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/using-mdx.mdx#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import HeaderLink from "../../components/HeaderLink.astro"; Embedded component in MDX ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Hyperdrive configuration using Wrangler CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Hyperdrive configuration using the Wrangler CLI. This command sets up the Hyperdrive connection with the specified database connection string. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-postgres-ssr-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler hyperdrive create --connection-string="" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Cloudflare CLI via package managers in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing the Cloudflare CLI tool using different package managers including npm, pnpm, and yarn. These commands initialize a new Cloudflare project using the latest version of the create-cloudflare package. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest # or pnpm create cloudflare@latest # or yarn create cloudflare@latest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Hyperdrive Configuration for PostgreSQL DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Hyperdrive configuration named 'hyperdrive-configuration' with a PostgreSQL connection string and caching disabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/postgres-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler hyperdrive create hyperdrive-configuration --connection-string="postgres://:@:5432/" --caching-disabled ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Document Example in Code Block DESCRIPTION: Sample HTML5 document structure showing basic elements and syntax within a code block. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` Example HTML5 Document

Test

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Lint Command in Cloudflare Templates CLI DESCRIPTION: Command usage example for finding and fixing template style issues beyond Prettier and ESLint capabilities. Focuses on Cloudflare-specific configuration and project structure with an optional --fix flag for automatic corrections. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/cli/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ npx tsx src/index.ts help lint Usage: cli lint [options] [path-to-templates] find and fix template style problems Arguments: path-to-templates path to directory containing templates (default: ".") Options: --fix fix problems that can be automatically fixed ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the MySQL Hyperdrive Project Locally with Remote Database DESCRIPTION: Command to run the project locally while connecting to a remote database using Wrangler's remote mode, which executes the Worker in Cloudflare's environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/mysql-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler dev --remote ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Upload Command in Cloudflare Templates CLI DESCRIPTION: Command usage example for uploading template contents to the Cloudflare Templates API. The command accepts a path to the templates directory and is typically run in CI on merges to the main branch. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/cli/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ npx tsx src/index.ts help upload Usage: cli upload [options] [path-to-templates] upload templates to the templates API Arguments: path-to-templates path to directory containing templates (default: ".") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Running with Wrangler DESCRIPTION: Commands to build the application and start it using Wrangler, Cloudflare's command-line tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/remix-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run build npm start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Project Setup Commands - Bash DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to initialize the project, create D1 database, run migrations, and deploy the Worker. These steps are required for setting up the template. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/d1-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install npx wrangler d1 create d1-template-database npx wrangler d1 migrations apply --remote d1-template-database npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating D1 Database for OpenAuth DESCRIPTION: Command to create a D1 database named 'openauth-template-auth-db' using Wrangler CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/openauth-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler d1 create openauth-template-auth-db ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying the React Router Application to Cloudflare Workers DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the built application to Cloudflare Workers. This requires a Cloudflare account and will deploy to your custom workers.dev subdomain. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Project with the Template in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to start a new project using the React + Vite + Hono + Cloudflare Workers template. This uses the Cloudflare CLI to generate a new project based on the template repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/vite-react-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/vite-react-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating TypeScript Types for Cloudflare Bindings DESCRIPTION: Command to generate TypeScript types for Cloudflare bindings defined in wrangler.json. This ensures type safety when working with Cloudflare-specific features. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run typegen ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying the Application DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the application using Wrangler CLI SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/to-do-list-kv-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying the Hyperdrive-MySQL Project DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the project to Cloudflare Workers using Wrangler CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/mysql-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying to Cloudflare Workers DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Remix application to Cloudflare Workers platform. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/remix-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying the Durable Chat App DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Durable Chat App project using Wrangler, Cloudflare's command-line tool for managing Workers projects. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/durable-chat-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying to Cloudflare Workers in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the built application to Cloudflare Workers using Wrangler CLI. This uploads your application to Cloudflare's global edge network. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/vite-react-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying the Cloudflare Worker Project DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Cloudflare Worker project using Wrangler. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/postgres-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using HTML Elements within Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to incorporate HTML elements like abbreviations, subscripts, superscripts, keyboard inputs, and highlighting within Markdown content. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` GIF is a bitmap image format. H2O Xn + Yn = Zn Press CTRL + ALT + Delete to end the session. Most salamanders are nocturnal, and hunt for insects, worms, and other small creatures. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying OpenAuth Server DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the OpenAuth server project using Wrangler CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/openauth-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Promoting a Version to Production on Cloudflare Workers DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy a specific version to production after verification. This can be used for progressive rollouts of new features. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npx wrangler versions deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating D1 Database in Cloudflare using Wrangler CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Cloudflare D1 database named 'admin-db' using Wrangler CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler d1 create admin-db ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting a New Project with Cloudflare C3 CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new project using this template with the Cloudflare C3 CLI (create-cloudflare). This initializes a new project based on the multiplayer globe template. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/multiplayer-globe-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/multiplayer-globe-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating KV Namespace DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Cloudflare Workers KV namespace for storing to-do list items SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/to-do-list-kv-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler kv namespace create TO_DO_LIST ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating New Project with Cloudflare Template DESCRIPTION: Command to start a new project using this template with the create-cloudflare CLI (C3). SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/postgres-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/postgres-hyperdrive-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating KV Namespace for Authentication Storage DESCRIPTION: Command to create a KV namespace named 'AUTH_STORAGE' using Wrangler CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/openauth-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler kv namespace create AUTH_STORAGE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Cloudflare Binding Types DESCRIPTION: Command to generate TypeScript types for Cloudflare bindings defined in wrangler.toml configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/remix-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run typegen ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building the React Router Application for Production DESCRIPTION: Command to create an optimized production build of the React Router application. This bundles and optimizes all assets for deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Astro Blog Project with Cloudflare C3 CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new project using the Cloudflare C3 CLI tool with this Astro blog template. This uses the create-cloudflare package to scaffold a new blog project based on the template. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/astro-blog-starter-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Docker container for local development DESCRIPTION: Commands to run the Docker container for local development. This sets up a PostgreSQL instance and seeds it with initial data from the init.sql file. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-postgres-ssr-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker-compose up -d npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Project with Cloudflare C3 CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to start a new project using this template with the Cloudflare C3 CLI tool. This sets up the Durable Chat App template in a new project. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/durable-chat-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/durable-chat-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Development Server for Durable Objects in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local development server for the Durable Objects application, allowing local testing and development. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/hello-world-do-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Next.js Development Server DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Next.js development server, which enables hot-reloading during development. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/next-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Development Server with Hot Module Replacement DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local development server with Hot Module Replacement (HMR) enabled. This makes the application available at http://localhost:5173. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing OpenAuth Template via C3 CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new project using the OpenAuth template through Cloudflare's C3 CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/openauth-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/openauth-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Development Server in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local development server for the SaaS Admin Template project. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating New Project from Template - Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new project using the Cloudflare C3 CLI tool with this D1 template. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/d1-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/d1-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing the Template via C3 CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new project using this template with the Cloudflare C3 CLI tool (create-cloudflare). SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/mysql-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/mysql-hyperdrive-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Development Server for Remix Application DESCRIPTION: Command to run the development server for local development of the Remix application. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/remix-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Project with the Text To Image Template DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new project using the Text To Image template via Cloudflare's C3 CLI tool (create-cloudflare). SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/text-to-image-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/text-to-image-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Development Server in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to run the development server with hot module replacement. This will make the application available at http://localhost:5173. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/vite-react-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating New Project with Durable Objects Template in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize a new project using this template with the Cloudflare C3 CLI tool outside of the repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/hello-world-do-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/hello-world-do-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Previewing the Production Build Locally DESCRIPTION: Command to preview the production build locally before deployment. This allows testing the built application in a production-like environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run preview ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Next.js Project DESCRIPTION: Commands to install project dependencies using various package managers including npm, yarn, pnpm, or bun. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/next-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install # or yarn install # or pnpm install # or bun install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying the Multiplayer Globe App DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the application to Cloudflare Workers using Wrangler CLI. This uploads and activates the project on Cloudflare's edge network. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/multiplayer-globe-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Durable Objects Template in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to install project dependencies using various package managers. This is the first step before starting development on the Durable Objects template. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/hello-world-do-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install # or yarn install # or pnpm install # or bun install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying the Text To Image Application DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Text To Image application to Cloudflare Workers using Wrangler CLI tool. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/text-to-image-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Previewing Production Build in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to preview the production build locally before deployment. This allows testing the production version of the application on your local machine. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/vite-react-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run preview ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Blog Post YAML Frontmatter Configuration DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter block defining metadata for a blog post including title, description, publication date, and hero image path. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/second-post.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- title: "Second post" description: "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet" pubDate: "Jul 15 2022" heroImage: "/blog-placeholder-4.jpg" --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying a Preview Version to Cloudflare Workers DESCRIPTION: Command to upload a version of the application as a preview URL. This allows testing the deployed application before promoting it to production. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npx wrangler versions upload ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting API Token in Environment Variables DESCRIPTION: Example of adding an API token to the .dev.vars file for authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` API_TOKEN=your_token_here ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies with NPM DESCRIPTION: Command to install the necessary dependencies for the MySQL Hyperdrive template project. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/mysql-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building for Production in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to build the project for production deployment. This creates optimized assets ready for deployment to Cloudflare Workers. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/vite-react-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies with NPM DESCRIPTION: Command to install the project dependencies using npm package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/postgres-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required project dependencies using npm SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/to-do-list-kv-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Project Dependencies Installation DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required project dependencies using npm package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/openauth-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying to Cloudflare Workers in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the SaaS Admin Template to Cloudflare Workers. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run deploy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies with npm DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required dependencies for the Text To Image application using npm package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/text-to-image-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for SaaS Admin Template in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required npm dependencies for the SaaS Admin Template project. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required dependencies for the project as defined in package.json. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/vite-react-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Database Migrations Remotely in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to execute database migrations on the remote production database. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ npm run db:migrate:remote ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Command to install the necessary project dependencies using a package manager. This step is required before deploying the project. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/durable-chat-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Production API Token in Cloudflare Workers using Wrangler DESCRIPTION: Command to set the API token as a secret in Cloudflare Workers production environment using Wrangler CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler secret put API_TOKEN ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Worker Locally with Remote Database Connection DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Cloudflare Worker project locally while connecting to a remote database using Wrangler's remote development mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/postgres-hyperdrive-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler dev --remote ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Environment Variables File in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a .dev.vars file for local development environment variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Create a .dev.vars file for local development touch .dev.vars ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for React Router + Cloudflare Project DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required dependencies for the React Router starter template. This should be run after cloning or creating the project. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/react-router-starter-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Database Migrations Locally in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to run database migrations in the local development environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/saas-admin-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ npm run db:migrate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Code Blocks with Syntax Highlighting in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create fenced code blocks with language-specific syntax highlighting using backticks. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ```html Example HTML5 Document

Test

``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Ordered Lists in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows the syntax for creating numbered lists with automatic ordering in Markdown. Second item 3. Third item ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Tables in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the syntax for creating tables with headers and formatted content in Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Italics | Bold | Code | | --------- | -------- | ------ | | _italics_ | **bold** | `code` | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Nested Lists in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement hierarchical lists with indentation for creating parent-child relationships in list items. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - Fruit - Apple - Orange - Banana - Dairy - Milk - Cheese ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Blockquotes with Attribution in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows how to format blockquotes that include citation and attribution using HTML elements within Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > Don't communicate by sharing memory, share memory by communicating.
> â€” Rob Pike[^1] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Simple Blockquotes in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create blockquotes without attribution, including formatting options within the blockquote. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > Tiam, ad mint andaepu dandae nostion secatur sequo quae. > **Note** that you can use _Markdown syntax_ within a blockquote. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Markdown Image Syntax DESCRIPTION: Shows the syntax for adding images in Markdown using the alt text and path format. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/astro-blog-starter-template/src/content/blog/markdown-style-guide.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![Alt text](./full/or/relative/path/of/image) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Local Development URL Reference DESCRIPTION: Markdown link showing the local development server URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/d1-starter-sessions-api-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying with Cloudflare Deploy Button DESCRIPTION: Markdown snippet for the Cloudflare deploy button that allows one-click deployment of the template. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/d1-starter-sessions-api-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [![Deploy to Cloudflare](https://deploy.workers.cloudflare.com/button)](https://deploy.workers.cloudflare.com/?url=https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/tree/main/d1-starter-sessions-api-template) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating New Project with C3 CLI DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize a new project using the Cloudflare C3 CLI tool with this template SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/to-do-list-kv-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm create cloudflare@latest -- --template=cloudflare/templates/to-do-list-kv-template ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Command to install the necessary project dependencies using npm. This needs to be run after cloning or creating a new project from the template. SOURCE: https://github.com/cloudflare/templates/blob/staging/openauth-template/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wrangler d1 migrations apply --remote openauth-template-auth-db ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Unordered Lists in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create bullet point lists using the hyphen syntax in Markdown.
